channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The 69-year-old man was moving cattle to higher ground when he and his vehicle were swept away.
item.title: Queensland man dies after being swept away in floods near NSW border

item.description: The best photos from 2020 as captured by the award winning photographers at The Age.
item.title: 2020: The Year In Pictures - The Age

item.description: Jason Kilar never has been afraid of trying to prove naysayers wrong. This time he has a lot of Hollywood heavy-hitters against him.
item.title: WarnerMedia chief has become a movie villain in Hollywood

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: An elderly man who was found unresponsive in a Blue Mountains home where a woman was found dead on Tuesday has been charged with her murder.
item.title: Man charged with murder after woman found dead in Blue Mountains home

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: China was trying to separate Australia from its ally the US, just as it had attempted to do with Canada over Huawei, the ex- US national security adviser said.
item.title: China's treatment of Australia is a 'sign of things to come' for world, says John Bolton

item.description: Two of the Chang’e 5’s four modules set down on the moon on December 1 and collected about 2 kilograms of samples by scooping them from the surface.
item.title: China's Chang’e 5 capsule returns to Earth carrying moon rocks

item.description: Canadian companies Tilray and Aphria have agreed to combine their operations, forming a new giant in the fast-growing cannabis industry.
item.title: The $5b green giant: World's biggest cannabis company created after merger

item.description: That Hennessy has gone citing the collision between work and family once again spotlights the exacting nature of political life, and women politicians are the ones who frequently find its balancing act hardest to sustain.
item.title: Jill Hennessy the most significant loss yet to the Andrews government

item.description: The Trump administration fires another parting shot at international trading partners which could complicate matters for US President-elect Joe Biden's incoming team.
item.title: Trump fires parting shot as US labels Switzerland, Vietnam as currency manipulators

item.description: Wall Street edged higher in afternoon trading as investors continue to balance hope for additional aid from Washington with a spike in virus cases that continues holding back a broad economic recovery.
item.title: ASX set for gains as Wall Street hovers around record highs

item.description: Bitcoin surpassed $US20,000 for the first time, another milestone in what's been an eye-popping rally for the controversial digital asset this year.
item.title: Bitcoin surpasses $US20,000 for first time amid dizzying rally

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Nine-year-old Ella Kissi-Debrah lived just 25 metres from one of London's busiest roads in the years before her death.
item.title: In legal first, coroner finds Ella's death was caused by air pollution

item.description: The fugitive widow of an IS gunman and a man described as his logistician have been convicted of terrorism charges in the trial of 14 people linked to the January 2015 attacks in Paris.
item.title: Fugitive widow one of 14 convicted in Charlie Hebdo, kosher market attacks

item.description: Israel’s justice minister says he has signed an extradition order to send former teacher Malka Leifer to Australia to face charges of child sex abuse.
item.title: Israel signs extradition order in Malka Leifer sex-crime case

item.description: The US Secretary of State has come into contact with someone who tested positive for the coronavirus, the US State Department said.
item.title: Mike Pompeo to quarantine after contact with COVID-positive person

item.description: Germany reported a record level of coronavirus deaths as it entered a harder lockdown, closing shops and schools to try to bring down stubbornly high new daily infections.
item.title: Germany enters harder lockdown as coronavirus deaths hit new high

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: After years of waiting for Sonny Bill Williams, Paul Gallen has moved on. He beat Mark Hunt, and now Gallen is eyeing off a fight against another UFC star.
item.title: Gallen labels SBW 'yesterday's hero' before targeting Rob Whittaker

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: After making short work of New Zealand's Bowyn Morgan, Tim Tszyu is eyeing a world title fight against Brian Castano. But that's just the beginning.
item.title: Tim Tszyu aims for world title - and then to become unified world champion

item.description: For all its bluster over human rights, is the West really willing to give up lucrative ties with Beijing? We condemn with one voice while quietly continuing to invest with the other.
item.title: Is the West really willing to cut ties with Beijing?

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Planning and Public Spaces Minister Rob Stokes has weighed into the debate about whether a Sydney golf course should be cut in half to provide more parkland.
item.title: Rob Stokes says Moore Park golf course should be reworked, not halved

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The construction of a southern concourse is aimed at improving access to platforms at Sydney's sixth-busiest station.
item.title: $100m Redfern train station upgrade to start within weeks

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The young all-rounder announced himself as a Test batsman of the future one afternoon last year in Brisbane and is set to make his debut for Australia on Thursday.
item.title: 'Made for Test cricket': The day Cameron Green arrived

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: A proposal for simpler energy bills has been released by the energy market rule maker, which it says will help consumers find their best deals.
item.title: Simpler bills to power energy savings

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The mid-year budget update will show a better bottom line than that predicted in October thanks to much higher iron ore prices and a better jobs market.
item.title: Job ads back to pre-pandemic levels as iron ore improves budget deficit

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: NSW government minister Victor Dominello has thrown his support behind a council in his electorate that voted to dramatically slash housing targets, opening the door for a policy rift with Minister for Planning Rob Stokes.
item.title: Ministers set to clash over plan to slash housing target by 40 per cent

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: The Australian Institute of Health and Welfare has for the first time released a national snapshot of the nation's health and how it was affected by COVID-19.
item.title: The year in health: COVID-19 sees surgery backlogs, cancer screenings dip and crisis calls soar

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: NSW Police workers' compensation claims for mental health issues have increased by 50 per cent in the past five years.
item.title: Soaring annual cost of dealing with injured NSW police passes $220 million

item.description: My heart pounded as I logged on to the UAC website to find out my score. My parents were at work, awaiting my call, expecting good news. I was so afraid as I scrolled down the page. Then I held my breath and braced for impact.
item.title: When I found out my HSC result, I felt like throwing up

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and superquiz, Thursday, December 17

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: The review has been brought forward by two years in the wake of damning public hearings into the gaming giant’s suitability in NSW.
item.title: Review of Crown Resorts' Melbourne licence fast-tracked

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: Australian political and business figures are beginning to speak out against Mathias Cormann's bid to lead the OECD due to his record opposing climate change action.
item.title: Bob Carr pens global letter that highlights government's resistance to climate change

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: It's been one weird year, all right, but Australians have proved themselves to be agile.
item.title: It's too soon to declare the recession over, but things are looking good

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: It is among proposals that will be considered by the NSW government during a public consultation period early next year, which will explore ways to protect gig economy workers when they are injured or die
item.title: Food delivery levy proposed to pay for workers' comp for the gig economy

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: A new report reveals the extent of CCP influence in local Chinese language media, and says WeChat may be driving the most substantial and harmful changes.
item.title: How WeChat is helping the CCP control Australian media outlets

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Australia's diagnostics medtech sector has raised serious cash in 2020 and is expecting more wins after a key US approval overnight.
item.title: Australian startups hope Ellume's success will help tap global markets

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The pink ball undoubtedly favours Australia but there's no reason why Virat Kohli's men should be fearful of the conditions.
item.title: Under lights: Five talking points for the day/night Test

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, December 17

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: The value of Australian salt beef in the English market has prompted a Sydney engineer to copy Mr Payne of London’s invention for curing meat.
item.title: In the Herald: December 17, 1842

item.dc:creator: Larissa Ham
item.description: The pressure will likely be on to celebrate hard this silly season, so anyone wanting to cut back – or cut out – alcohol will need a few concrete strategies up their sleeve.
item.title: Kate saved $10,000 cutting booze. Here's how she stuck to it

item.description: On December 17, 1985, the electric motor powering a carriage on a suburban "red rattler" exploded into flames, injuring five passengers.
item.title: From the archives, 1985: Motor explodes in 58-year-old train carriage

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Was Troy Grant's recent resignation from the NSW Nationals driven by solid forward planning?
item.title: Grant's new water gig a long time in the pipeline

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Optimism has returned to Victoria's $42 billion property sector after the pandemic but the industry is desperate to get office workers back to their desks.
item.title: Lost in space: Office return key to economic lift-off, property sector says

item.description: The relentless focus on winning in our culture comes with significant costs, particularly for our children.
item.title: Life's not a competition to be won, it's a journey of highs and lows

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Deputy NSW Premier John Barilaro will front a parliamentary inquiry into his government’s council grants scandal despite Premier Gladys Berejiklian refusing to attend the hearings.
item.title: Barilaro to front council grants inquiry despite Premier's absence

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: The inaugural art event will turn the top end of town into an al fresco gallery open 24 hours a day.
item.title: Empty shopfronts and laneways become galleries for new Melbourne festival

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Police plan to expand their drug diversion program and will look to trial international harm-reduction schemes as part of a five-year drug strategy.
item.title: Police take health-focused approach to tackle rising drug use

item.dc:creator: Tony Blakely
item.description: The major risk to countries like us is the virus getting back in through leakage from quarantine and international arrivals.
item.title: Strengthen our front line by vaccinating border control workers first

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: The billionaire is being pursued for aggravated damages in the Supreme Court of Victoria over allegations he assaulted a man and threatened to have him sacked on New Year's Day 2016.
item.title: James Packer sued by security guard over alleged casino assault

item.description: Amid growing tensions with China, India provides opportunities for Australian exporters.
item.title: India can help solve Australia's trade problems with China
